My game crashes immediately after I open it on windows 7, can anyone help? The game looks amazing!
When I started it, it loaded the first time.  Went to campaign, started new game, and it crashed.  I loaded again, tried again, and it worked.  Win7 64-bit here.
installed and ran last night fine, went to start it up today and the process starts but that game never does.

As a courtesy to azaq318, and for those of you who are having troubles:

- The game will not work in XP, as it does not support DX11.
- You cannot just click the exe to make it run; use the desktop shortcut as there's a parameter required for the program to launch properly.
I never had the desktop shortcut made, will I have to reinstall?

Thanks azaq! This proper works perfectly.

@lulwat: I've only been using the desktop shortcut that was created during the install. I copied the "target" for the shortcut and created a new one that also seems to work fine.

Right-Click on your desktop and select "New." Then select "Shortcut." Windows 7 has a prompt that will pop up. You only need to paste the "target" information in there and it will take care of the rest.

"C:Program Files (x86)A Game of DwarvesA Game Of Dwarves.exe" -bundle-dir .

Copy that with the quote at the beginning and the period (.) at the end. Edit whatever you need to make it point to your file/folder location. Then the game should load fine.

I too am having the crash-on-startup problem, using Windows 7 64-bit, and starting with the correct desktop shortcut.  Pity.
I managed to overcome the problem, and get the game working.  I did it by reinstalling a copy of DirextX 11 from another source, that the game installation overwrote.  Works fine now.
